item.title: New Blog 2018
item.description: This week I've been working on yet another new blog. It feels a little silly, since I never manage to keep up with writing entries, but maybe this time will be different. It's also a very small enjoyable project that I can finish and cross off the list. The current version feels pretty similar to last time, but the trick is that this time I'm statically generating the pages offline in C++.

item.title: Thoughts on the PEI Electoral Reform Plebiscite
item.description: In the recent PEI plebiscite MMP was selected as the "winner" using an alternative vote. First Past the Post received the most first choice votes, so in some sense (plurality), it's the "winner". That's clearly an unfair system, but the alternative vote, which chose MMP, isn't necessarily a fair system either! The total number of votes for MMP and DMP combined - votes for a proportional system - clearly beat FPTP.

item.title: How Does This Work Again?
item.description: I haven't written anything for this blog in a while, so I forget how it was working. Maybe I should further document my process! It occurs to me that I have a few posts about this blog, but nothing seriously describing what it is or how it works! I also forget my password. Entries are written in HTML with a few meta tags at the top. These can then be FTP'd to the server.

item.title: New Ear Training Regime
item.description: At the beginning of the year, I had a really bad ear. I found it difficult if not impossible to learn to play things by ear. Any ear training that I'd ever attempted felt difficult or fruitless. Now, I've written software to generate music flash cards for myself, which I've dubbed 'Owl', and have embarked on a new ear training regime. So far it feels incredibly enjoyable and productive! Motivation When learning a language one school of thought is to, rather than relying on learning list of grammar rules, is to just learn a lot of sentences.

item.title: No Markdown!
item.description: Yesterday, I decided that it would be really nice if I could edit my posts in markdown. There are definitely some easy to find php libraries for parsing markdown, so I didn't think it would be too much work. This morning, however, integrating a library in seemed like it was going to be just a little too much busy work. Instead, how good is sublime at editing HTML? I installed the Emmet plug in, which does some pretty cool stuff, but it's overkill.

item.title: Ergodox Navigation Layer
item.description: When I decided on the ergodox, it was mostly because I wanted a split keyboard that didn't have staggered rows. The fact that it was entirely programmable was a neat perk. Before the ergodox came, I spent a lot of time thinking about how I wanted to lay out the keys. I've done a lot of things that make sense to me, which I haven't seen in any other layouts that I've come across.

item.title: Configuring my Ergodox Using Python
item.description: Setting up the build for the ergodox firmware went pretty smoothly. I couldn't get the Teensy loader application to work with my ergodox on linux, but on windows everything went smoothly. The online configurator tool didn't quite suit my needs. I wanted to add keys that were CTRL+key, SHIFT+key, and so on, which weren't supported with massdrop's tool Modifying the code for the layout in C was ugly and error prone.

item.title: The Slippery Slope to Ergonomics
item.description: A couple of months ago, I decided that I would consider buying an ergonomic keyboard. The next week, I noticed a Facebook post about a synth instrument on Kickstarter. This got me to thinking about using regular computer keyboards for playing synth. It's certainly never been a satisfying experience any time that I've tried it. Though, what if a keyboard didn't have staggered rows? What if the keys were all layed out in a grid?

item.title: Korean
item.description: Lauralee would like to go on a trip to Seoul sometime, and I was at Freeman's with Jess and Craig, and they were talking about a trip to visit Kyle sometime. I decided to start learning a bit of Korean now, and see how functional I can get it by then. I've been at it for about a month now, and so far I feel like it's been my most efficient language learning venture so far!

item.title: New Blog(s)
item.description: It's that time again. Every so often, I feel like I should keep a blog; sometimes I actually do it! A few times I've had word press set up, and other times I've hobbled things together myself. It's just nice to feel like I have a place where I can dump random things. The main CookWithChef page is now going to be a house Word Press blog. The old cook with chef site has moved to chef.
